edu.ncsu.csc216.howlondemand.platform

Class HowlOnDemandSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.howlondemand.platform.HowlOnDemandSystem

  • public class HowlOnDemandSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Finite state machine that manages track selection from a selected station and the streaming of those tracks. HowlOnDemandSystem follows the singleton design pattern, meaning that only one instance can exist at a given time.
    Author:
    Noah Benveniste

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static HowlOnDemandSystem getInstance()
        Used to access the singleton instance of the HowlOnDemandSystem object. If the method hasn't been called before, a new instance of the object is created. Otherwise, a reference to the already created instance of the HowlOnDemandSystem is returned.
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the HowlOnDemandSystem

      • loadStationsFromFile

        public void loadStationsFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws edu.ncsu.csc216.audioxml.xml.StationIOException,
                                 edu.ncsu.csc216.audioxml.xml.MalformedTrackException
        Creates a collection of Stations from an XML file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file
        Throws:
        edu.ncsu.csc216.audioxml.xml.StationIOException - if there is an issue reading in the XML file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if more than 9 stations are loaded
        edu.ncsu.csc216.audioxml.xml.MalformedTrackException - if any of the stations contain bad track data
